creator: soletan@toxa.de
text:
I've upgraded my httpd-2.0.43 with (same configure-arguments) to 2.0.44 quite 
after receiving your announcing mail. Today - quite a few days later - I 
realised WebDAV not working properly any more.

After testing a bit with the configuration - I probably changed some settings 
in the past - I tried to downgrade to httpd-2.0.43 again and voila everything 
was working fine ...

#####################################
DavLockDB /tmp/davlockfile
DavMinTimeout 600
#
<Directory /sharedir>
    Dav On
    AuthType Basic
    AuthName "dav section"
    AuthUserFile /etc/httpd/passwords/dav-pw

    Order Allow, Deny
    Allow from All
    Satisfy All

    Require user admin
</Directory>

#####################################

user admin exists in given htpasswd-file ... I don't know what changed. 
Directory structure contains .DAV subdir and access right on all used dirs is 
rwxr-s--- and owned by nobody:www ...


Thomas Urban

What do you mean with "not working properly"? What happens (not)?, are there
error log entries or something?
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Also note that your server should not be starting at all with that configuration
since
Order Allow, Deny
is not valid (the space after the comma should be removed).

Plus, as you say yourself, this is likely a configuration problem and therefore
not an appropriate subject for the bug database.  I suggest you try a user
support forum:
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
Thanks for your immediate answer, but the server works, just change it to

Order Allow,Deny

It retyped that from my ssh-shell window while lacking of a copy-and-paste 
feature. Sorry!

I've done all the things manuals allow and if behaviour of some module changes 
while your CHANGES file doesn't inform about something (obviously) related, I 
expect it to be a "bug", some side-effect of other changes or similar. 

Well, I don't know the time you invest and apparently you don't know vice versa 
the time I've lost for handling that trouble I had because of following "your" 
recommended upgrade. Is it all you'd like to invest???

By the way, I'm no rookie and programmer for the last 15 years. And having side-
effects seemed to be something to expect.


Thanks again,
Thomas Urban
creator: soletan@toxa.de
nd@perlig.de
text:
Well, I'm asking again: what exactly doesn't work as expected? What error
messages come up? What Clients are used? Without a detailed description there's
no way to reproduce your problem.

Thanks.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Sorry, I misread your report slightly, which is why I closed it.  I'll
reopen pending your response to Andre.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text: No further response. Attempting to close this bug.
